intro: Morphixia paniculata var. tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered morphixia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and delicate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warm season. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with similar morphological features.
